author: BuzzFeed
title: Skiers, snowboarders remain undeterred in search of flakes
text:
Local Journalism Initiative Skiers, snowboarders remain undeterred in search of flakes Read full article Local Journalism Initiative January 4, 2024 at 2:23 a.m. Â· 4 min read Nothing was going to stop Jacob Tessier and his family from enjoying a few days of skiing at Horseshoe Resort.
A couple of months ago, the Sarnia resident booked a Christmas vacation at The Inn at Horseshoe, north of Barrie. On Christmas Day, he cancelled it because the forecast called for rain.
A week later, on New Yearâ€™s Day, he called the resort back to check on conditions. When he heard there were a number of ski runs open, he packed up the family and they headed north.
â€œWe came up Monday morning,â€ Tessier said. â€œWeâ€™ve been skiing the last two days and itâ€™s been OK, actually.â€
With 13 of 29 runs open and a base depth of 25 centimetres, the slopes arenâ€™t in perfect condition, but theyâ€™re more than serviceable for those, like Tessier and his family, who want to get outside and have some winter fun, even if it means foregoing the challenging runs.
â€œWe spent yesterday on the Bunny Hill and it was great, not too icy,â€ Tessier said. â€œToday, weâ€™re going to try a couple of green runs.â€
For Oakvilleâ€™s Katherine Shantz, the less-than-ideal winter conditions are actually a good thing. She took her daughters, who are beginner skiers, to the resort specifically because they knew it wouldnâ€™t be at capacity.
â€œOne of my daughters has been skiing once before and the other one has never skied, so we thought this would be the best time to come,â€ Shantz said. â€œThis has worked out really well. Itâ€™s not crowded and the temperature is perfect.â€
According to Sarah Tyler, marketing manager at Horseshoe, the Tessier family is just one of many who have booked a holiday vacation at the resort. She said the hotel has been sold out a few nights over the Christmas break and guests have made the best of the unpredictable weather conditions.
â€œThereâ€™s lots to do here â€” from skiing, snowboarding and tubing to swimming and walking trails,â€ Tyler said. â€œAs the temperatures are supposed to go down this week and next, weâ€™ll be in really good shape in a couple of weeks.â€
Story continues At Mount St. Louise Moonstone, a 15-minute drive north of Horseshoe on Highway 400, the parking lot was already half full at 9:30 on Wednesday morning.
Thirty-one of the resortâ€™s 35 runs are open and thereâ€™s a solid base of between 25 and 55 centimetres.
Inside the chalet, the lineups for lift tickets were building and the rental equipment staff was busy outfitting folks with skis, poles and boots.
Steve Young isnâ€™t surprised to see the hustle and bustle. Heâ€™s a coach with the Toronto Ski Club in the Collingwood area and heâ€™s visiting the ski hill with 18 members of the club so they can get in some early season work.
â€œPretty much everybody who actually skis knows Mount St. Louis is going to be making lots of snow, so this is the place to come if other places arenâ€™t open,â€ Young said. â€œThe conditions have been pretty good.â€
The conditions Young refers to are a direct result of Mount St. Louis Moonstoneâ€™s commitment to making snow.
Having been in the business for years, the Huter family, which owns Mount St. Louis Moonstone, knows Mother Nature is going to need a helping hand and theyâ€™ve invested heavily in state-of-the-art snow-making technology.
â€œWhen the weather gets cold enough to make snow, we can turn it on and have great results in no time,â€ said Nick Huter. â€œThe guys here have done a great job making snow and weâ€™re pretty happy with where we are right now.â€
Snow Valley Ski Resort, just north of Barrie, has five of 20 runs open with a 50-centimetre base.
Pamela Disera, director of the Snow Valleyâ€™s snow school, said the resort has some good conditions and will be able to improve them once the temperatures drop a bit, which is expected to happen over the next 14 days, according to Environment Canada.
â€œWeâ€™re hoping to make more snow over the next little while and if we can we will open more terrain and more runs,â€ Disera said.
Featuring a relatively small hill, Snow Valley has secured a reputation as a great place to learn how to ski or snowboard. Christmas break is when newcomers traditionally visit the resort, Disera said.
â€œWeâ€™re missing those people who are just starting out,â€ Disera said. â€œThe beginners didnâ€™t come this year because they didnâ€™t know to follow us on social media or they donâ€™t know we make snow.
â€œLetâ€™s hope the season goes longer and weâ€™re knee-deep in snow during March break.â€
Wayne Doyle, Local Journalism Initiative Reporter, BarrieToday.com
TRENDING 1. PMO clarifies Trudeau and family stayed 'at no cost' during vacation in Jamaica 2. Vancouver lawyer suspended after accusations of pseudolegal 'paper terrorism' over neighbour's deck 3. Calgary-bound flight diverted to Winnipeg, teen arrested after mid-air assault: RCMP 4. Mother serving life sentence for murdering 8-year-old daughter dies in B.C. prison 5. The Supreme Court is expected to determine whether Trump can keep running for president. Here's why

title: Hombres Roban la Casa de la Exesposa de Carin LeÃ³n; Esto se Sabe
text:
Hombres Roban la Casa de la Exesposa de Carin LeÃ³n; Esto se Sabe
N+
La exesposa del cantante CarÃ­n LeÃ³n denunciÃ³ a travÃ©s de su cuenta de Instagram, que fue vÃ­ctima de robo en su casa en Hermosillo.
COMPARTE:
Alejandra Esquer, exesposa del cantante Carin LeÃ³n, publicÃ³ a travÃ©s de Instagram historias en donde dio a conocer que fue vÃ­ctima de robo en su casa el pasado sÃ¡bado 12 de julio alrededor de las 8:00 de la noche en Hermosillo.
En las publicaciones Alejandra, compartiÃ³ videos donde se muestra el modus operandi de los ladrones, en este se observa cÃ³mo llegan a bordo de una camioneta Lincoln color plata y proceden a violentar la puerta con la finalidad de ingresar a la propiedad ubicada en un residencial en Hermosillo, Sonora.
Noticia Relacionada: Suman 25 Menores Detenidos por Robo con Violencia Cerca del Cerro de la Campana de Hermosillo
La exesposa de Carin LeÃ³n lamentÃ³ los hechos y solicitÃ³ apoyo para alertar y concientizar sobre este tipo de hechos de inseguridad, ademÃ¡s seÃ±alÃ³ que no solo entraron a llevarse algo material, si no que realizaron destrozos por toda su propiedad.
Para finalizar, Esquer mostrÃ³ su agradecimiento y preocupaciÃ³n ante los hechos informando que se encuentra bien y compartiÃ³ que las autoridades ya se encuentran realizando las investigaciones correspondientes para dar con los responsables del robo, ademÃ¡s, dijo que cualquier informaciÃ³n que ayude a esclarecer el caso serÃ¡ recompensada.
QuiÃ©n es Alejandra Esquer exesposa de Carin LeÃ³n
Alejandra Esquer es una influencer y empresaria originaria de Hermosillo, Sonora, lugar donde conociÃ³ a su ahora exesposo el cantante del regional mexicano CarÃ­n LeÃ³n.
Alejandra tiene 34 aÃ±os y se dedica a subir contenido a su cuenta de Instagram en donde tiene casi 200 mil seguidores, sobre temas como moda, relaciones pÃºblicas y estilo de vida.
AdemÃ¡s de esto participa en un podcast llamado â€œMitÃ³te energÃ©ticoâ€ junto a Marcia Minelly, una reconocida estilista en Hermosillo y otras amigas.
Historias Recomendadas:
con informaciÃ³n de Raquel Rosillo.

author: Christopher Yasiejko
title: Novartis Fights MSN's Push to Delist Revived Entresto Patent
text:
MSNâ€™s attempt to delist US Patent No. 8,101,659 from the US Food and Drug Administrationâ€™s registry of approved drugs is legally flawed because the underlying lawsuit concerns standard patent-infringement claims rather than Hatch-Waxman allegations, the Swiss drugmaker said Wednesday in a brief supporting its motion to dismiss in the US District Court for the District of Delaware. Novartis also separately asked the court to reject MSNâ€™s ...

author: archyde
title: Major Accident on A15 Motorway near Manage, LiÃ¨ge: Traffic Updates and Road Closures
text:
2023-12-28 08:00:00
It was around 3:45 a.m. during the night from Wednesday to Thursday when an accident occurred between two vehicles on the A15 (E42) motorway towards LiÃ¨ge and near Manage. Shortly after, a truck appeared on the roadway, was unable to avoid the two vehicles for a still unknown reason and hit them. He then found himself on his side and spread out across the entire roadway.
Luckily, whether it was the accident or the subsequent accident, there were only three minor injuries who escaped well given the circumstances. The damage is therefore mainly material.
On the other hand, the highway has been completely blocked since these accidents occurred and there are numerous traffic problems. The three traffic lanes are thus closed as well as the emergency lane between kilometers 95 and 99 of the highway.
Diversions have been put in place while the road is cleared, particularly via the N59 towards Seneffe, but the sector should be strongly avoided.
1703806231
#double #accident #vehicles #truck #Manage #paralyzes #E42 #motorway

author: Shaun Prescott
title: This sci-fi horror racer is one of my favorite PC games, and it's currently going for less than a fiver during the Steam racing fest | PC Gamer
text:
(Image credit: Refract) When Distance released in 2018 it felt like a big deal. It's a grimy sci-fi arcade racer blending the nightmarish vibes of Thumper with the cheerful time-attack moreishness of Trackmania. It's both zen-like and quietly disturbing. It's blisteringly fast, but it has a strange tranquilizing effect. I adore it, and I don't know why people don't talk about it more often.
In addition to a long campaign that manages to blend psychedelic set pieces with precision-oriented racing, there's dozens of arcade tracks ranging from seamless high-speed sprints through to elaborate freeform trick arenas. It also has Steam Workshop support, so there are thousands of user-made tracks to download and play. Not all of them are Mario Kart remakes and vaporwave tributes either (don't worry: there are a lot of those if you want 'em). There's online and splitscreen multiplayer too, though after years of playing Distance I've never touched either.
Sorry to be that guy but you have to get it: it's currently 90% off on Steam , bringing it down to $2.49. It was one of the first games I installed when I got a Steam Deck, and I was immediately blown away by how gorgeous it still looks. Other sci-fi racers like Redout have a more elaborate art style that wends closer to WipeOut, but Distance is more like WipeOut's cyber-goth cousin: less eager to please and more fun to be around. It's kinda special in the sense that it's a sci-fi racer that doesn't seem completely indebted to Psygnosis' vision.
